channel.title: DBMS on wubigo
channel.description: Recent content in DBMS on wubigo

item.title: Mysql Notes
item.description: showing current configuration mysql>SHOW VARIABLES; mysqldump -u root -h 192.168.76.62 -pgld --all-databases > dump.sql mysqldump -u root -h db -pgld --all-databases > dump.sql then import data in mysql shell mysql>source dump.sql update the database if directly upgrade from 5.0 to 5.5 mysql_upgrade -u root -p service mysql restart A typical mysqldump command to move data from an external database to an Amazon RDS DB instance looks similar to the following:
